content: ginkgo leaf by vicki monthei the ginkgo or gingko is such an odd tree it s considered a living fossil the ginkgo is a symbol of many good things hope resilience a ginkgo survived an atomic bomb with little damage peace longevity a ginkgo can live 1000 years strength a time of balance and control etc this pattern works up quickly with very little yarn it s a great way to use up bits of yarn in your stash a knit ginkgo leaf would make a great decoration on keyrings backpacks gift boxes or bags the leaf is 3 75 inches wide and 2 5 inches long blocked to gauge without the stem it takes less than 2 hours to knit a leaf skills needed cast on slip knit german turn or use your favorite turn technique and bind off in knit stitch optional i-cord stem gauge is not important in this pattern any block-able yarn/thread will work make a swatch to check gauge and appearance 14 yards of koigu s kpm or kpppm yarn will make 1 leaf with stem at gauge 7 stitches/inch and 14 row/inch in garter stitch - blocked with koigu s kpm or kpppm yarn and u s #3 3 25mm needles notes this pattern uses standard u s knitting abbreviations including ytb yarn to back of work between the needles without making a new stitch i used the german turn technique but you can use your favorite technique for turning pattern is on page 2 ginkgo leaf page 2 cast on 20 sts row 1 sl1 p-wise ytb k to end row 2 sl1 p-wise ytb k to last 4 sts turn k to end row 3 sl1 p-wise ytb k to last 6 sts turn k to end row 4 sl1 p-wise ytb k to last 8 sts turn k to end row 5 sl1 p-wise ytb k to last 10 sts turn k to end row 6 sl1 p-wise ytb k to last 12 sts turn k to end row 7 sl1 p-wise ytb k to last 14 sts turn k to end row 8 sl1 p-wise ytb k to last 16 sts turn k to end row 9 sl1 p-wise ytb k2 turn k to end row 10 sl1 p-wise ytb k4 turn k to end row 11 sl1 p-wise ytb k6 turn k to end row 12 sl1 p-wise ytb k10 turn k to end row 13 sl1 p-wise ytb k12 turn k to end row 14 sl1 p-wise ytb k14 turn k to end row 15 sl1 p-wise ytb k17 turn k to end row 16 bobble 7 turn co 7 repeat row 2 through 15 bind off loosely in k st if you d like to add an i-cord stem use the last 3 stitches for the stem work as long a stem as you like optional increase 2 or 3 sts at the stem s axil work stockinette stitch for 2 row then bind off block gently
